attributes.action: lower the petrol and Diesel prices on the UK forecourts
attributes.additional_details: It's time the so called government stops ripping drivers off and give back.  It's soon going to be a case of you can't afford to fill up car because they only care about themselves.  The UK has high fuel prices with a very low wages for a lot of households.  Time to get something back instead if lining the government's pockets
attributes.background: Fuel prices today don't seem to be regulated. On monday you could pay 125.9 a litre but then on Tuesday it could be 127.9 then again come Friday it could be up again.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Forecourt petrol prices are set by retailers.

You could start a petition asking the Government to reduce or remove fuel duty, or to set a cap on fuel prices, if that is what you would like to see happen.
